title: Halloween Show!: At Midnight I’ll Take Your Soul (1964)
brief_description: On 'Devil's Night,' the Lexington Film League Showcase at 21c presents a special Halloween screening of At Midnight I'll Take Your Soul (1964), a Brazilian horror film directed by José Mojica Marins, better known as 'Coffin Joe.'
description:
On 'Devil's Night,' the Lexington Film League Showcase at 21c presents a special Halloween screening of At Midnight I'll Take Your Soul (1964), a Brazilian horror film directed by José Mojica Marins, better known as 'Coffin Joe.' The film was programmed by Phill Kisling, who will introduce the show.

At Midnight I’ll Take Your Soul is a 1964 Brazilian horror film that is the first instance of the character known as Zé do Caixão or translated to english Coffin Joe. The film starts with an old witch telling us to not watch this evil film, to turn away but together we will not heed her superstitious ramblings! Together we will witness the horrific acts of Zé do Caixão as he searches for the perfect woman to carry on his evil bloodline, in attempt to defy God himself!

title: Italian Beaches Album Release (Two Sets)
brief_description: Italian Beaches Album Release (Two Sets) at The Burl.
description: Italian Beaches Album Release (Two Sets) at The Burl. The band will be playing an early and a late set. Early set will start promptly at 8pm. Late set will start a little less promptly at 10pm with Emily Hagihara and Her Sounds of Fire. Come to one or all.

title: R. C. May Photography Lecture: Lori Nix & Kathleen Gerber
venues: Gatton College of Business and Economics at the University of Kentucky
brief_description: The first artist in the 2017-18 R.C. May Photography Lecture Series,  photographers Lori Nix and Kathleen Gerber discuss their collaborative images of constructed environments
description: The first artist in the 2017-18 R.C. May Photography Lecture Series,  photographers Lori Nix and Kathleen Gerber discuss their collaborative images of constructed environments. Lecture will be in the Gatton Business College, Kincaid Auditorium. Admission is FREE and open to the public. An exhibition of their photographs is on view from October 7-December 3, 2017. For more information about their work visit http://finearts.uky.edu/art-museum

title: Higher
organizers: Thank you for Comming to Our Parties
brief_description: You know this is the best place to dance to disco in the country right?
description: You know this is the best place to dance to disco in the country right? We will turn the lights off, turn the volume up, and forget the outside world and its troubles. We do hope that you’ll join us.

title: Tinderbox Circus Sideshow / Ford Theatre Reunion / io Ravine
brief_description: Tinderbox Circus Sideshow will be dragging their butts back off the road and taking over Cosmic Charlie’s for a variety-filled smorgasbord of ridiculousness
description:
Ages 18+
$8 ADV
$10 at the door

Hey Lexington, get ready for a DOUBLE FEATURE!
On December 1st, Tinderbox Circus Sideshow will be dragging their butts back off the road and taking over Cosmic Charlie’s for a variety-filled smorgasbord of ridiculousness starting at 8:00pm! That’s right! You read it! We’ll have nonstop entertainment from our friends and loved ones filling your eye and ear holes from 8:00pm into the wee hours of the night!

*SIDESHOW!* *LIVE MUSIC!* *RAFFLE PRIZES!*

Come and be awed and amazed by our wide array of performers from coast to coast bringing you the best and most glorious stunts and feats from the world of SIDESHOW!
...BUT IT DOESN’T STOP THERE!

Come and get your mind blown by local music from io Ravinevine and heavy hitters Ford Theatre Reunion!!

**Stay tuned for the official schedule for the evening, raffle prize tiers, and performer announcements in the coming weeks, but until then...gear up and buy those tickets!
Because they’re available NOW! Save $2 NOW by purchasing your tickets by clicking the link above!**

Part of this event’s proceeds go to the first ever work convention for sideshow professionals, The Southern Sideshow Hootenanny! For more information, visit their Facebook page or the website at http://www.southernsideshowhootenanny.com/

title: R.C. May Photography Lecture: Teju Cole
brief_description: The 2017-18 R.C. May Photography Lecture Series continues with a lecture by acclaimed photographer, writer, and art historian, Teju Cole
description:
The 2017-18 R.C. May Photography Lecture Series continues with a lecture by acclaimed photographer, writer, and art historian, Teju Cole. Lecture will be in the Gatton Business College, Kincaid Auditorium. Admission is FREE and open to the public. An exhibition of his photographs is on view from October 7-December 3, 2017 in the Art Museum. For more information about his work visit http://finearts.uky.edu/art-museum

Cole is the photography critic of the "New York Times Magazine" and an award-winning novelist ("Open City") and essay writer ("Known and Strange Things"). These works have earned a variety of honors including the PEN/Hemingway Award, the New York City Book Award for Fiction, the Focus Award from the Griffin Museum of Photography, and the Windham Campbell Prize for fiction from Yale University. Raised in Nigeria, Cole currently resides in Brooklyn.
